description:
Title and Location: Principal ML Scientist. Santa Clara, CA.

Job Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and deploy Deep Learning software robotic solutions to industrial agriculture equipment in large customer farms.
• Leading the development and rollout of new CVML/Robotics features for See and Spray.
• Architect, design, and develop the data pipeline and platform supporting machine learning development.
• Managing a group of machine learning engineers and providing mentorship and guidance for other members of the machine learning group.
• Follow recent developments in Deep Learning (a field in computer vision) research and suggest implementations in vision-based agriculture solutions.
• 100% remote working allowed; can live anywhere in the US; 10% domestic travel required.

Qualifications
• Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related field or foreign academic equivalent. 6 years of experience.
• Required skills: Research Computer Vision and Machine Learning algorithms to solve business problems for internal and external customers. Implementing supervised and unsupervised Computer Vision algorithms for depth from image, object detection, object similarity matching, and motion segmentation (6 years).
• Developing ML/DL models. Performing literature review, dataset creation (collection and annotation), model development, training, and validation ( 6 years).
• Deploying algorithms to run in real-time on embedded devices like Raspberry Pi or Nvidia Jetson (5 years).
• Deploy Deep Learning based solutions using software frameworks Tensorflow or PyTorch in Python and C++ to solve real-world problems with semi-autonomous or autonomous robotic operation in complex, unstructured visual environments (4 years).
• Select, design, evaluate, and deploy multi-modal sensor solutions used for detection, depth estimation, and localization including but not limited to mono and stereo cameras, rotating and solid-state lidars, GNSS, IMU, and ultrasonic sensors (4 years).
• Develop sensor calibration systems for Camera intrinsic and extrinsic, Lidar extrinsic and multi-modal Camera, Lidar, GPS, and IMU systems (4 years).
• Manage a team of engineers and researchers to implement and deploy novel ML solutions on autonomous robotic systems from inception to production (3 years).
• 100% remote working allowed; can live anywhere in the US; 10% domestic travel required.

Full time. $239,200 - $312,000/year. Please visit https://bluerivertechnology.com/join-us/ to apply.

#LI-DNI
